name: optgroup
summary: The `<optgroup>` HTML element creates a grouping of options within a select element.
tagOmission: The start tag is mandatory. The end tag is optional if this element is immediately followed by another `<optgroup>` element, or if the parent element has no more content.

disabled.name: disabled
disabled.summary: If this Boolean attribute is set, none of the items in this option group is selectable. Often browsers grey out such control and it won't receive any browsing events, like mouse clicks or focus-related ones.

label.name: label
label.summary: The name of the group of options, which the browser can use when labeling the options in the user interface. This attribute is mandatory if this element is used.
